mediterraneanCrisis.source: FAO-GFCM. 2023. The State of Mediterranean and Black Sea Fisheries
facts: The Mediterranean represents less than 1% of global waters but accounts for 7% of all marine species
Over 90% of Mediterranean fish stocks are overfished
Industrial fishing fleets have increased 10-fold in the last 50 years
Traditional small-scale fishing communities are being displaced
Illegal, unreported, and unregulated (IUU) fishing accounts for 30% of catches

implemented.title: Fishing Quotas
implemented.description: Science-based catch limits in many countries

needed: Elimination of harmful subsidies ($35 billion annually)
Expansion of marine protected areas to 30% by 2030
